roleset.name: to preside over as a chairperson with another

role.descr: Focus, first or plural mention of person/s serving as chair
Second chairperson when separate mention, arg0 chairs with whom?

example.name: passive
example.text: Following the loss of the Republican Party led by US President George Bush in the midterm congressional elections, which were considered a referendum on US involvement in Iraq, came the Study Group report on US policy options in Iraq, which-4 *T*-4 is cochaired *-4 by former Secretary of State James Baker and former Congressman Lee Hamilton...
example.arg: which-4 --> the Study Group report on US policy options in Iraq
by former Secretary of State James Baker and former Congressman Lee Hamilton...

example.name: with co-chair as separate mention
example.text: Mary co-chaired the committee for panda rights with John.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'co-chair' based on survey of sentences in Webtext 2.5-2. No VerbNet entry for co-chair, chair. Comparison with 'chair.'
